SENTENCE.STRING: is a stratovolcano, located on the Alaska Peninsula, United States.
is one of the volcanoes in the vicinity of the Valley of Ten Thousand Smokes.
Although an eruption in 1953 is now considered questionable and no other confirmed eruptive activity has taken place at
, there is intense fumarolic activity within
The summit crater is also breached to the southeast.
The 300 m (984 ft)-wide summit crater is often ice-free due to the geothermal heat and contains an intermittent acidic crater lake.
The fumaroles in the summit crater produce extensive sulfur deposits.
is named for George C. Martin, who was the first person to visit the Valley of Ten Thousand Smokes after the 1912 eruption of Novarupta.
